Package com.nishant.complexcalculator

Class ComplexCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nishant.complexcalculator.ComplexCalculator
  • public class ComplexCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class can compute mathematical operations based on an expression. The expression is stored in String function.
    Since:
    18-09-2019

    • Constructor Detail

      • ComplexCalculator

        public ComplexCalculator​(java.lang.String function)
        Instantiate the object with an expression. The function can perform the following operations:-
        • Exponent (^)
        • Division (/)
        • Multiplication (*)
        • Addition (+)
        • Subtraction (-)
        If you like to involve variables in the function, you are most welcome to do so. If there are any variables, you must map them to double values in a Map<Character, Double> collection. The method will replace the variables with your value and compute the given task.

        You can use pi in the middle of the function to use the mathematical value of Math.PI.
        You can also you E to denote exponent. For example, 3.0E10 = 3.0 * 1010. The rules of using E will coincide with that of Double:-
        • The digits after E must not be fractional
        • The digits before E must have a integral and a fractional part.
        Parameters:
        function - given expression.

    • Method Detail

      • compute

        public double compute​(java.util.Map<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.Double> variableMap)
        Returns the answer of the given expression.
        The map collection has a character key and a double value. Each Character in the key will be replaced by its respective double value before computer the expression.

        The following with result in Exceptions:-
        • replacing E as a variable.
        • using unexpected letters.
        • missing round brackets.
        • using brackets other than round brackets
        • use of curly or square brackets.
        • variableMap is null.
        • function is null or empty.
        • If other unknown computing error occurs.
        • If there is any error in the code.
        Parameters:
        variableMap - characters in key will be replaced by its respective double value.
        Returns:
        the solution to the given expression and value of variables.
        See Also:
        Double, Map
